page.title: 19POLLUTION
page.content: Two brooks converge in the centre of Blakeney and they are under constant threat from industrial pollution. In 1984 all fish and subsequently a heron died as a result of extensive caustic acid poisoning. Nuclear power stations, just across the R. Severn, routinely discharge radioactive particles into the atmosphere but the main discharge is into the river. A cluster of childhood leukaemias was found in a nearby area this side of the river in 1978-82 and families involved had close ties with the river. It is difficult to tell what the true hazards of radioactive pollution are as the effects of contamination can take up to 2 decades to emerge but as these leukaemias were found some 20 years after the stations were built, concern in the minds of some inhabitants is understandable.
